ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] grouping thread on the Everquest boards
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes.  I ve had some trouble getting people to understand I can t just chat away on the keyboard while we are fighting.  Most people just have no concept that s
ygData.messageBody:
Yes. I've had some trouble getting people to understand I can't just chat
away on the keyboard while we are fighting. Most people just have no
concept that's bards fingers seldom leave the keyboard or stop moving for
more than a second while fighting.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Ken Bachman [mailto:kbachman@...]
Sent: Friday, June 30, 2000 5:39 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] grouping thread on the Everquest boards


I probably end up leading about 1/4 of the time, more when I'm in pickup
groups,
less in guild events. I really would prefer not to have to; leadership
requires
a fair amount of direction-giving during fights, and that interferes with
song-weaving. I don't think it's as much of a problem when my warrior
leads, for
example.

Kenross Cantoforjado, 51 songs, Innoruuk


Mike Roach wrote:
>
> How often do you bards take the role of group leader? I think that our
> broad knowledge of class abilities and our support playing style tends to
> make us excellent leaders and I often find people want ME to lead the
group,
> or if they don't ask and I find myself in a group that lacks clear
> leadership I gradually just assume the role even if I wasn't the one to do
> the initial inviting.
